creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
As soon as any element is added to the test tree, there seems to be an NPE from 
ProxyControlGUI. The debug trace (below) shows that the model field is null.

2003/12/09 16:42:09 DEBUG - jmeter.protocol.http.proxy.gui.ProxyControlGui: 
Reinitializing target combo 
2003/12/09 16:42:09 DEBUG - jmeter.protocol.http.proxy.gui.ProxyControlGui: 
Selecting item Use Recording Controller for model null in 
org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.proxy.gui.ProxyControlGui[HTTP Proxy 
Server,0,0,0x0,invalid,layout=java.awt.BorderLayout,alignmentX=null,alignmentY=n
ull,border=javax.swing.border.EmptyBorder@9e592c,flags=9,maximumSize=,minimumSiz
e=,preferredSize=] 
2003/12/09 16:42:09 ERROR - jmeter.gui.action.ActionRouter:  
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.proxy.gui.ProxyControlGui.reinitializeTargetComb
o(ProxyControlGui.java:692)
	at org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.proxy.gui.ProxyControlGui.access$0
(ProxyControlGui.java:665)
	at 
org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.proxy.gui.ProxyControlGui$1.actionPerformed
(ProxyControlGui.java:562)
	at org.apache.jmeter.gui.action.ActionRouter.postActionPerformed
(ActionRouter.java:332)
	at org.apache.jmeter.gui.action.ActionRouter.performAction
(ActionRouter.java:119)
	at org.apache.jmeter.gui.action.ActionRouter.access$0
(ActionRouter.java:105)
	at org.apache.jmeter.gui.action.ActionRouter$1.run(ActionRouter.java:99)
	at java.awt.event.InvocationEvent.dispatch(InvocationEvent.java:178)
	at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(EventQueue.java:454)
	at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForHierarchy
(EventDispatchThread.java:201)
	at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy
(EventDispatchThread.java:151)
	at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:145)
	at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:137)
	at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(EventDispatchThread.java:100)

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
This is in fact a duplicate of 25141. Not resolving it as duplicate (yet)
because the title of this one is more descriptive of the actual error seen and I
don't want it reported over and over.

In any case, it has a known cause and it is harmless.
